comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] Rivet guns at dawn! I found the SMH articles Freeman wrote a couple of years ago, and I seem to remember he had a convincing argument. The drama was all played out in the pages of the Sydney Morning Herald, beginning in March 1929 with Ralph Freeman's three articles - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/16537020 trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/16537285 trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/16537599 Bradfield's reply - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/16540437 Freeman's counter reply - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/16540661 etc, etc ...

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] these are fantastic documents! I'd seen the first 3 articles by Freeman, but not his counter reply. Of course Freeman was only in Australia for relatively brief periods during the construction of the HB, but I wonder whether the animosity between Freeman and Bradfield might also explain why we see so little of Freeman in the various HB pics...maybe he kept a certain distance from Bradfield. nla.gov.au/nla.news-article16688734 - pic of Freeman and his family on their arrival in Sydney in ?late July 1930 nla.gov.au/nla.news-article16670396 - Freeman's 1930 SMH article on the closure of the upper and lower chords.
